intro: Siphocampylus canus, commonly known as the whiteleaf milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the milkweed family, Apocynaceae, and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant produces showy, pink to reddish flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as butterflies and bees. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in fine, white hairs, giving it a silvery appearance. Siphocampylus canus is adapted to arid environments and has a deep root system to access water in dry soils.
